thread.title: Leicester can WIN the Champions League, insists boss Craig Shakespeare ahead of Sevilla second leg
thread.title_full: Leicester can WIN the Champions League, insists boss Craig Shakespeare ahead of Sevilla second leg

author: James Nursey
title: Leicester can WIN the Champions League, insists boss Craig Shakespeare ahead of Sevilla second leg
text:
Sport Leicester can WIN the Champions League, insists boss Craig Shakespeare ahead of Sevilla second leg The Foxes host the La Liga side at the King Power on Tuesday evening and Shakespeare is setting his sights on a long run in the competition Share Shakespeare is in bullish mood ahead of the second leg (Photo: Getty) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Craig Shakespeare insists Leicester can win the Champions League as he aims to continue his 100% record on Tuesday night. 
Shakespeare is preparing for his first game since being confirmed in the Leicester job until the end of the season. 
The champions host Sevilla and Shakespeare is hopeful City can progress despite trailing 2-1 from the first leg of their last 16 tie. 
Shakespeare has already overseen 3-1 home wins over Liverpool and Hull as caretaker since Claudio Ranieri was sacked. 
Now Shakespeare is aiming high despite the Foxes being 100-1 to win the competition. (Photo: Leicester City FC) Jamie Vardy's goal in Seville gave Leicester hope in their last-16 tie (Photo: Michael Regan) 
Asked if last term's 5,000-1 title heroes could lift more silverware, Shakespeare, 53, replied: “Why not? 
“We are in it and we have to try and be competitive every game. 
“For me there is no free game in football. 
“You have to try and win every game you go in and show that determination and competitiveness. 
“We have to show that in abundance against Sevilla.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
